Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the filibuster was not an idea of the founding fathers.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the founders were aware that some provisions in the Constitution could be used for delaying tactics, even if that was not their intention.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to prove that the filibuster was not an idea of the founding fathers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the founders had no intention of including provisions that could be used for delaying tactics.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the Senate was designed to cool the passions of the House, which could be seen as a precursor to the filibuster.
